name: Stramonium
Relationship: Compare especially: HYOSCY. and BELL. It has less fever than BELL., but more than HYOS. It causes more functional excitement of the brain, but never approaches the true inflammatory condition of BELL.Antidotes: BELL.; TABAC.; NUX.

Eyes: Seem prominent, STARING WIDE OPEN; pupils dilated
Loss of vision; complains that it is dark, AND CALLS FOR LIGHT
Parts of the body seem enormously swollen
Fever: Profuse sweat, which does not relieve
Stomach: Vomiting of mucus and GREEN bile
Modalities: Worse: looking at bright or shining objects
Mind: DEVOUT, EARNEST, BESEECHING AND CEASELESS TALKING
Loquacious, garrulous, laughing, singing, swearing, praying, rhyming
Sees ghosts, hears voices, talks with spirits
Rapid changes from joy to sadness
Delusions about his identity; thinks himself tall, double, a part missing
Cannot bear solitude or darkness; MUST HAVE LIGHT AND COMPANY
Sight of water or anything glittering brings on spasms
Head: RAISES HEAD FREQUENTLY FROM THE PILLOW
Pain in forehead and over eyebrows, beginning at nine AM; worse until noon
Boring pain, preceded by obscure vision
Rush of blood to head; staggers, with tendency to fall forward and to the left
Auditory hallucinations
Face: Hot, red; circumscribed redness of cheeks
Mouth: Cannot swallow on account of spasm
Female: Puerperal mania, with characteristic mental symptoms and profuse sweatings
Skin: EFFECTS OF SUPPRESSED ERUPTION IN SCARLATINA, with delirium, etc
Extremities: Convulsions of upper extremities and of isolated groups of muscles
Trembling, twitching of tendons, staggering gait
Male: SEXUAL ERETHISM, with indecent speech and action

details: The entire force of this drug seems to be expended on the brain, though the skin and throat show some disturbance. Suppressed secretions and excretions. Sensation as if limbs were separated from body. Delirium tremens. Absence of pain and muscular mobility especially of muscles of expression and of locomotion. Gyratory and graceful motions. Parkinsonism.
